title: trace data errors on ETH Holesky when upgrading from erigon version "2.55.1-12889fd0" to erigon version "2.56.2-c9216ce1"
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `2.56.2-c9216ce1`

OS & Version: Linux

Chain/Network: ETH Holesky

#### Expected behaviour
Trace data getting returned succesfully

#### Actual behaviour
`invalid arguments; block with number 60000 not found`

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
```
{
  "method": "debug_traceBlockByNumber",
  "params": [
    "0xea60",
    {
      "tracer": "callTracer"
    }
  ],
  "id": 1,
  "jsonrpc": "2.0"
}
```
Older blocks returned that error, blocks at the tip were fine.

Downgrading the node to `2.55.1-12889fd0` fixed the issue

I upgraded a node, I don't know if these logs are related to this issue but they don't look great.

```text
erigon[18443]: [WARN] [01-19|16:50:41.434] [1/12 Snapshots] Some blocks are not in snapshots and not in db max_in_snapshots=499999 min_in_db=679000

erigon[18443]: [WARN] [01-19|16:51:02.079] [snapshots] retire blocks                err="DumpBlocks: DumpHeaders: header missed in db: block_num=1,  hash=e9011e6d15a0d0c16f65a38f84375bf1a6b88201b0ad75a2660df0bb8d1ac381"
```

However, as soon as I upgraded, the cURL failed:

```bash
curl -s -H 'Content-Type: application/json' localhost:8545 -d "$DATA"
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":null,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"invalid arguments; block with number 60000 not found"}}
```

I downgraded back to 2.55.1 and everything looks fine again, no errors, cURL works fine..

This is a huge problem as upgrades are mandatory.
Since I can't find any indication that this is affecting either Goerli or Sepolia, I'm going to try to resync Holesky from Genesis on the latest version. Maybe my nodes are just screwed up...

hey @yperbasis I just wanted to let you know, working with @quickchase above, and we resynced from Genesis, and we had some issues: 

**the method eth_getBlockByNumber isn't working, I tried on multiple blocks. I had a method to scrape a few of them**

```
sakbar@NODE:~$ curl -s -H 'Content-Type: application/json' localhost:8545 --data '{"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["0xaf5dc",false],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}'
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":null}
sakbar@NODE:~$ curl -s -H 'Content-Type: application/json' localhost:8545 -d '{
  "method": "debug_traceBlockByNumber",
  "params": [
    "0xaf5dc",
    {
      "tracer": "callTracer"
    }
  ],
  "id": 1,
  "jsonrpc": "2.0"
}'
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":null,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"invalid arguments; block with number 718300 not found"}}
```

The blocks get executed but the methods aren't working: 

```
sakbar@NODE:~$ sudo journalctl -u erigon | grep '718300'
Jan 11 23:03:12 erigon[4878]: [INFO] [01-11|23:03:12.789] [NewPayload] Handling new payload        height=718300 hash=0xdcef3b773f3f6d97264364a6769c11382c7ae476583e66cafd41c9582adf41f6
Jan 11 23:03:13 erigon[4878]: [INFO] [01-11|23:03:13.273] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=718299 to=718300 hash=0xdcef3b773f3f6d97264364a6769c11382c7ae476583e66cafd41c9582adf41f6 header sending=11.221Âµs log sending=281ns
Jan 11 23:03:13 erigon[4878]: [INFO] [01-11|23:03:13.274] head updated                             hash=0xdcef3b773f3f6d97264364a6769c11382c7ae476583e66cafd41c9582adf41f6 number=718300
Jan 11 23:03:25 erigon[4878]: [INFO] [01-11|23:03:25.549] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=718300 to=718301 hash=0xc8fec67899494fdfc5fcc51cbf379351e821820ee865160d586793b74c68fa04 header sending=17.934Âµs log sending=311ns
Jan 19 19:56:21 erigon[19702]: [INFO] [01-19|19:56:21.961] [4/12 Execution] Executed blocks         number=718300 blk/s=9.6 tx/s=186.5 Mgas/s=152.3 gasState=2.26 batch=103.8MB alloc=932.4MB sys=5.4GB
```

Just to confirm we downgraded to v2.55.1 and it was working, so something in the new release is still acting up: 

```
root@INFO:/opt/erigon# curl -s -H 'Content-Type: application/json' localhost:8545 --data '{"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["0xaf5dc",false],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}'
```

This is resolved now, resync was the solution. The lost posted by @yaanakbr were from before the resync. His tests were from before the node finished syncing haha ðŸ˜Ž
